intro: Glochidion excorticans var. calvum, commonly known as the smooth glochidion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous bark and simple, alternate leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow-green in color. This variant is distinguished from other forms of Glochidion excorticans by its lack of pubescence on the stem and leaves.
